cleaned_text: When it comes to inclusivity, the beauty industry undoubtedly has some work to do—and we're going to do it together. The dermatology and skin care fields, in particular, have blemishes that we simply can't dismiss. [Bustle](https://www.bustle.com/style/diversity-gap-in-skin-care-bipoc-representation-dermatologists) notes that dermatology is the diverse area of medicine, with Black dermatologists accounting for only 4 percent of all dermatologists in the U.S. And in a sampling of 58 skin care studies, 75 percent of participants were white. But are Black, Indigenous, People of Color (BIPOC) skin tones a minority? Definitely not.
